fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 If a user searches for issues associated with next-gen sprints, the search doesn't return subtasks.

h3. Environment

Jira Software cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Scrum next-gen project
# Add stories to the project and add some subtasks to the stories
# Create a sprint in the next-gen board's backlog and add stories which have subtasks to the sprint
# Access the search page and search issues by the next-gen sprint name

h3. Expected Results

All issues are returned, including subtasks

h3. Actual Results

Only stories are returned

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Search for issues associated with next-gen sprints doesn't return subtasks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is not possible to upload mp4 files to Jira.

Only really small files seem to be working.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Try attaching a video file to an issue by any method available:
** Using the clip icon (attachment button);
** Files and images button in the comment;
** Drag and drop the file.


h3. Expected Results

The file will be uploaded.

h3. Actual Results

Jira fails to load the file:
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-19 at 13.59.51.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

Tested file formats:
* mp4;
* AVI.

Tested files size:
* 48mb
* 8mb

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Cannot upload video files to Jira

fields.description:
h3.Summary

If the role name is too long, it can get truncated. In the situation where you have a few role name with similar naming convention, it will not be possible to tell apart which role the user is currently selecting.

For example :

 !Role_truncated.PNG|thumbnail! 

Option to enable  pop up description that contains the full name of the role on mouse hover will be useful in such situations. Something similar to how Windows shows pop up description on hover.

 !image-2019-08-19-21-01-53-469.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Not possible to differentiate between project roles due to truncation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When updating issue type in Next-Gen, the user is being redirected to the Move Issues page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in a Next-Gen project;
 # Add multiple issue types in the Next-Gen project (Story and Task for example);
 # Try to update the issue type.

See:  [^Screen Recording 2019-08-16 at 03.43 PM.mov] 

h3. Expected Results

Issue type would be updated like in Classic projects.
h3. Actual Results

The user is redirected to the Move Issues page.

h3. Workaround

Follow the Move Issues process to update the issue type.
fields.summary: When updating issue type in Next-Gen, the user is redirected to the Move Issues Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Fields not added to screens do not show up in the old issue view but when users are using the new issue view the fields show up. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a software project and create issues
# Ensure that the screen mapped to that project does not include the *Story point* field.
# Enable the new issue view (in case it isn't enabled) and look at the issues in the project

h3. Expected Results
* We expect to not see the *Story point* field since it is not mapped to any screen. 

h3. Actual Results
* We see the *Story point* field with a *None* value. 

 !Screen Shot 2019-08-16 at 7.59.29 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* The same behavior is identified with other fields

h3. Workaround

* Remove the field from the *Issue layout* configuration in the project settings
* Disable the new issue view for the now. To disable the new issue view, please follow the steps described below:

# Go to Jira home page and click on the avatar at the bottom-left of the screen and then click on *Personal settings*
# Under *Jira labs*, next to *New Jira issue view for software projects*, disable this feature by clicking on the green button (it will become gray and a feedback pop-up will appear)
fields.summary: Fields not added to screens are visible in the new issue view

fields.description: It would be great if the import of Trello content under *External System Import* could be performed to existing Jira projects. Today, we can only create new projects to receive Trello Content.
fields.summary: Allow Trello content to be Imported in Existing JIRA projects
New issue view adds a paragraph after hitting enter on Description instead of hardbreak

fields.description:
Currently, by the nature of the field works, it doesn't allow indexing to be run from the backend to sync the new information from Jira. 

So let say, activity is being done from different browser tab. The new changes would not be reflected on the issue of view from the other tab

Use case:

"1. Open a given issue in our Cloud instance in one browser tab (e.g. "ANB-123")
2. Open Project -> Releases in another browser tab
2.1. Create a new release, e.g. called "1.2.3"
2.2. Switch back the the tab of the issue
3.1. If I now try to assign the Release Version "1.2.3" to my previously opened issue, the version is not found. 
3.2. If I refresh the issue tab for "ANB-123" and retry step 3.1. I will succeed."
fields.summary: Enhance the search index for field picker.

fields.description:
Currently, when an attachment fails to load on the new issue view, it's not possible to click on the image to open on a new tab or download it. 
It would be good if even if the thumbnail does not load, we still have the ability to click to download.
fields.summary: Keep link to the attachment even if it fails to load

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Incoming email will not create an issue if the content sent in the *subject* and in the *body* (generates *summary* and *description*, respectively) matches the content and issue type of another issue that has been created via email as well.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*1.* Case 1:
* Send an email to Jira with the following content:
** *Subject:* Test
** *Body:* test
* Send another email, with the exact same content:
** *Subject:* Test
** *Body:* test

*2.* Case 2:
* Send an email to Jira with the following content:
** *Subject:* Test 1
** *Body:* test
* Send another email, with the exact same content:
** *Subject:* Test 1
** *Body:* test 1
* *Case 2 works*.

h3. Notes

The problem will occur even if the body is blank in both messages.

It looks like that there is an interval where the issues will be created again:
* Sending 5 in a row will create the first and the fifth;
** After that, the third one sent in a row will be created.

That interval has not been  very consistent though.

h3. Expected Results

In both cases *1* and *2*, the issues should be created (a total of *4* issues).

h3. Actual Results

Case *1* will create just the first one sent (the final result will be *3* issues created).

h3. Workaround

If the content of the messages do not match, the issues are created.
fields.summary: Incoming email will not create issue if subject and body of the message matches one that has already been created via email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
REST API /rest/api/2/issue/id/notify is missing the Reply-To field
This API is triggered by some add-ons to send notifications about issue created or issue updated. The default Jira notification has the Reply-To field, however, when the notification is triggered using the API above, it does not include the Reply-To field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run the REST API /rest/api/2/issue/id/notify
# These are the fields returned
{code}
curl --request POST \
  --url 'https://mynameispaula.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/CS-23/notify' \
  --header 'Authorization: Basic <access_token>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "htmlBody": "Test",
  "subject": "Test",
  "textBody": "Test",
  "to": { "reporter": true },
  "restrict": {"permissions": [{"key": "BROWSE"}],
  "groups": [{"name": "filter"}]
  }
}'
{code}

h3. Expected Results
This API should include the Reply-To in order to send a notification for additional users

h3. Actual Results
It should include the same fields as the default Jira email notification

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: REST API /rest/api/2/issue/id/notify is missing the Reply-To field

fields.description:
Hi,

 

In the new Jira project, I have a roadmap of epics.

It would be great if you can have the sorting of the backlog map the roadmap ordering according to when an EPIC should be completed by. This makes backlog ordering much more efficient.
fields.summary: Sort backlog according to roadmap

fields.description:
In the JIRA app for Android, Boards are displayed very inefficiently, especially in landscape orientation. The headers (the rectangles around it, the text size is fine) for the different "swim lanes" are very big, and the bottom navigation also takes a lot of space away from the actual issue cards. With this poor use of space, in landscape mode, only one issue card is visible sometimes.

Can you improve the board display on mobile to be able to see more issue cards? Even reducing the white space in the header for the lanes would go a long way, but I think you can go much further: I think in this view, the top status bar of Android can be disabled (at the very least in landscape view), so the screen can go [Full Screen|[http://example.com|https://developer.android.com/training/system-ui/immersive]]. You can even hide the bottom navigation, if you do, the user can still bring it back with a swipe up from bottom, I don't thin it would cause problems.

Please do something with this screen, it is very hard to use in the current state. Thanks!
fields.summary: Display boards more space efficiently on Android

fields.description: Actually we are developing a new Feature for our Plugin and we would love to have Jira Application Events fired when a new Person or/and a new Resource is created in Portfolio.
fields.summary: Fire Application Event for new Resources/Persons

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating a Looping transitions on a workflow from "Any Status" to "Itself" after creation, you cannot be able to use the Advanced Configuration options as the links to it would be broken.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Goto any Workflow, add the "Any Status" to "Itself" transition and give it a name
 # Click on the newly added transition, on the right side of the screen where the Workflow Advanced configuration pops up for ( Properties, Conditions, Post-function etc.) 
 # Clicking on any of those URL links shows a 404 error.

h3. Expected Results

The URL link should be able to work

h3. Actual Results

The Link appears to have appended a workflow step parameter with "undefined" value and thus returns a 404 page when clicked.
{code}
https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/workflows/ViewWorkflowTransitionMetaAttributes.jspa?workflowMode=live&workflowName=Copy+2+of+Software+Simplified+Workflow+for+Project+AT&workflowTransition=51&workflowStep=undefined 
{code}
 !404-error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note
It seems as though Jira is expecting a workflow Status Step where there's none, as the transition is a loop to itself. Hence the "undefined" value added to the parameter.

h3. Workaround

* Save the workflow first before trying to access those Advanced Configuration.
* Reload the Workflow Configuration Page, before clicking on the Advanced configuration options.
fields.summary: Looping Transitions Workflow returns a Broken link for Advanced Configuration after creation.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

HardBreak node doesn't render from the new issue view.
h3. Environment

New issue view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a ticket from new issue view
 # Edit the description: add a numbered list eg. line1, line2, line3
 # Place the cursor at end of the line and Hit *Shift+Enter*
 # The hard break is visible
 # Hit Save
 # The hard brake is not visible any longer.
 # Enter the description in edit mode again the hardbreak node is visible

h3. Expected Results
 * Hardbreak node should be rendered from the editor.

h3. Actual Results
 * Hardbreak node not visible from the preview mode.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: HardBreak node doesn't render on the preview mode of new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have an entity property alias or custom field with the same name as a system field, and attempt to execute a JQL search using this ambiguous clause name, the system field's validation code kicks in and prevents you from searching over the custom field/entity property. 

Internally, the JQL execution code attempts to OR the multiple clauses for ambiguous clause names, but the validation code is kicking in sooner and breaking this.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a connect add-on which defines an entity property alias or add a custom field named "project".
 # add a value for that entity property/custom field to an issue which is not the name or key of a project (eg: 'bleh').
# Attempt to search for that value in JQL ({{project = bleh}}).

h3. Expected Results
One single issue in search results
h3. Actual Results
{{The value 'bleh' does not exist for the field 'Project'.}}

h3. Workaround
Use the {{cf[$id]]] or un-aliased entity property form of the clause names.
fields.summary: JQL validation failing on one instance of an ambiguous clause name fails the whole query

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the new issue view, there's no button *Assign* as the old view use to have.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the button (or an option) to have a screen to assign the issue for a user.

h3. Why this is important

On this screen, the user can perform an assign and add comment at the same time. This important because some times you need to assign the ticket and leave information during this action. Without this button, we need to do two actions. 

h3. Workaround 

Create a transition from any status to itself with a screen that has the assignee field.
fields.summary: Assign button on the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In new issue view and using Firefox browser, when editing Description field, using up and down arrow in a list does not go up and down one line, instead it jumps to the top of the text before the list, or to the end of the list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use Firefox browser to create an issue and create a list in Description field, can be numbered or bullet list
# Use the up and down arrow at any of the list members

h3. Expected Results
The cursor goes up or down of the list every time we press the up or down button.

h3. Actual Results
It jumps to the top of the text before the list, or to the end of the list.

h3.Workaround
Use old issue view to navigate the list or use Chrome browser.
fields.summary: In new issue view and using Firefox browser, when editing Description, using up and down arrow in a list behaves incorrectly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Due to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71945 bug related to copying Issue Security Scheme, the project administrator will need to reconfigure the original security scheme. If the administrator doesn't know about the bug, it will take time for them to update it and it will cause security impact if the incorrect group added to the security level configuration. 

It's best to highlight this bug on the [Configuring issue-level security|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-issue-level-security-776636711.html] documentation.

h3. Suggested Solution
Under *Copying an issue security scheme* section, highlight about the [Copying Issue Security Scheme Adds Incorrect Security Levels to Source Scheme|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71945] bug.

h3. Why this is important
This will cause a security problem when the incorrect group being added to the security level and it takes time for the administrator to update the original scheme.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Update on "Configuring issue-level security" documentation about known bug on copying an issue security scheme

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

Gif and image file attachments can't be downloaded from Jira in the old issue view. When clicking on an Issue attachment that is a GIF file and attempting to download it, you will be redirected to the source of the file being *api.media.atlassian.com* where you can download it using your browser and not Jira. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce 

# Add a GIF file to a Jira Issue and switch to the old issue view 
# Open that GIF file to preview then click on the *Download* button 

h3. Expected Results 

The file should be downloaded. 

h3. Actual Results 

Instead, you are redirected to *api.media.atlassian.com* to the source of the file.

 !2019-08-15_16-12-57.gif|width=400&height=200!

h3. Notes

This is especially more impactful on Service Desk Projects as they cannot switch to the old issue view.

h3. Workaround

Switch to the new issue view or use your browser's *Save image as...* to download the file.
fields.summary: Gif and image files can't be downloaded from Jira in the old issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a Jira issue from Zephyr Enterprise the issue link functionality does not work. The issue gets created but the issue link does not get added.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# While in Zephyr Enterprise create a Jira issue
# Enter the necessary field
# Add issue link
# Click Create issue

h3. Expected Results
The issue is created in Jira with the specified linked issue

h3. Actual Results
The issue is created in Jira but the linked issue field is empty

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue link not working in Zephyr Enterprise

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Refreshing the page after sorting the filters in the Manage Filters page (by "Starred by" or "Starred") results in an error message and unable to see the filter results.

h3.How to replicate
# Go to: https://<cloud_site>.atlassian.net/secure/ManageFilters.jspa
# Click arrow to sort by "Starred by" or "Starred" 
# Refresh the page

h3. Expected results
The filtered results showing in the browser

h3. Actual results
Blank page with an error message:
{quote}
Something has gone wrong

Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support.
{quote}

h3. Details:
Screen recording: [^managedfilter_sorting_error.mp4] 
Screenshot:  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
None at this time
fields.summary: Error on page refresh after sorting Filters by "Starred by" or "Starred"

fields.description:
AsciiDoc has become a very popular format for writing documentation, README files, website contents and even books in the open source community. It's well supported by tool chains for producing documentation and platforms such as GitHub which e.g. render AsciiDoc-formatted files.

It'd therefore be very useful if AsciiDoc could also be used when authoring Jira issues, e.g. in the description field and comments. That'd mean less friction when switching between different tools, as e.g. the syntax for hyperlinks differs between Jira and AsciiDoc.
fields.summary: Support AsciiDoc syntax in Jira issue descriptions and comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you remove (delete) an attachment from a Jira issue and re-add the same attachment, with the same name, inside the period for the batched notification send both actions in a single email, the event doesn't trigger the email. No notification is sent to the users for these events in the Jira issue. 

h3 Steps to Reproduce

# User A has deleted the attachment 123.png from the ticket ABC-1;
# User A adds the same attachment (123.png) deleted previously.

h3. Expected Results

A batched notification should send an email informing both changes (removed and added).

h3. Actual Results

No notification is sent for the users that should be notified, even if you set to notify your own changes, the notification isn't sent.

h3. Notes 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Batch notification email not send when the same attachment is removed and re-add to the issue

fields.description:
Natively, Jira counts with a great and very convenient feature: [global reflexive transitions|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/How-to-get-to-the-next-level-in-workflow-design/ba-p/1135968].

However, that feature is really difficult to discover, as it currently requires to:
# Enter the workflow editor in diagram mode.
# Click on the _Add transition_ button (please, note that the most popular method for adding transitions is drag&drop on status nodes).
# Select _Any status_ in the _From status_ dropdown field.
# Select _Itself_ in the _To status_ dropdown field.
# Add a Name & click on the Save button.

Counting with more intuitive ways through the UI for creating this kind of transition would be desirable.

Maybe it would be a good idea prompting a dialog on creating a looping transition (a transition from a status to itself). The dialog could show a concise text and a couple of buttons:
* *Text*: Looping transitions are frequently useful from other statuses too. Would you like to create a global looping transition?
* *Button 1*: Make global
* *Button 2*: No, thanks

Additionally, a _Read more_ or (?) icon would ideally link to a documentation page which explained the advantages of using global looping transitions.
fields.summary: UX: Facilitate natural discovery of global looping transitions

fields.description:
Hi

Could you please add the trollface emoji to Jira, Bitbucket and potentially other services. We feel like this is a really critical feature, which is for some reason missing. I'm sure it would be used a lot more than most emojis that are currently present.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Please add trollface emoji to Jira and bitbucket

fields.description:
In the new editor for issue comments, when users try to upload a file to comments the *Save* button is enabled even before the file upload is complete. 

In the old issue view:
When a user tries to save comments before the file is completely uploaded, a render message is shown to users that file is not uploaded.

In the new issue view:
Save button is enabled even before the file upload is complete and when users try to click on save nothing happens (because the file upload is in progress).

It would be good to have comments *Save* button disabled until the file upload is complete so that users get to know that file upload is still in progress and will try to save comments post file upload is completed.
fields.summary: Insert a file button should be enabled only when file is completely uploaded.

fields.description:
Going to https://<jira>.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa... results in infinite page reloads

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to {code}https://<jira>.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa...{code}
 # Watch as your browser continually reloads the page.

h3.Go to {code}https://<jira>.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa...{code}
h3. Your browser does not continually reload the page.


h3. Workaround

Do not go to {code}https://<jira>.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa...{code} .
fields.summary: Going to https://<jira>.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa... results in infinite page reloads

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to scroll custom fields' tab when accessing from within a filter

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Make sure that you have a screen tab with at least 19 fields. In order to configure the screen's tabs you can follow the steps described right below:
** [Configuring a screen's tabs and fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/defining-a-screen-776636475.html#Definingascreen-configureConfiguringascreen'stabsandfields]
* Open the advanced search in Jira
* Under views(top right corner) set as *List View*
* Click on a specific ticket from the search
* Open the tab with all the custom fields

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to scroll all and see all the custom fields available on the tab.

h3. Actual Results
You are not able to scroll and see all the fields.
 
h3. Notes
* Only applicable to new issue view.
* The problem it seems to be due to a CSS property that sets the overflow content as hidden.
**  !overflow.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
None available.
fields.summary: Unable to scroll custom fields' tab when accessing from within a filter

fields.description:
h3. Description
While using the issue navigator the link to see the old issue view is missing. For example, while accessing a filter there is no way to switch to the old issue view unless you access the ticket itself.

*Notes:*
If there is an approval status we can see/access the link to the old issue view
fields.summary: Issue navigator missing link to the Old Issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
*Single Email Address* notification is triggered by Jira but is not sent to the user. 

h3. Environment
- Jira Cloud version: 7c10101d

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure the _Browse Projects_ [Permission Scheme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-project-permissions-776636362.html] of a project to _Group (Anyone, including non-registered and anonymous users)_.
# Set one of the events (i.e. *Issue Created*) of the [Notification Scheme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-a-notification-scheme-776636401.html] of that same project to _Single Email Address_ and enter a valid one. Save the changes.

h3. Expected Results
The notification (in this case when a ticket is created) should be sent to the email address listed there. 

h3. Actual Results
No message is sent. 

h3. Workaround:
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: 'Single Email Address' notification is not working on Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Date picker select calendar icon does not appear in IE on the create form

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a new issue and try to use the date picker calendar icon to select a date

h3. Expected Results
The calendar will open and the user will be able to select a date

h3. Actual Results
The calendar icon is not appearing on the screen
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-13 at 10.42.47.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Use a different browser (like the Chrome) or click on the screen where the calendar should be appearing
fields.summary: Date picker select calendar icon does not appear in IE on the create form

fields.description:
h3. Summary
jira.issue.actions.order property not working


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# We can set the property as described on this doc:
** [Changing the default order for comments from ascending to descending|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/changing-the-default-order-for-comments-from-ascending-to-descending-884344544.html]
** Set as *desc*

h3. Expected Results
Comments order should be shown in the descendant order as configured.

h3. Actual Results
The comments are still being shown in ascendant order.
 
h3. Notes
* Reproduced on the old issue view.
* For the new issue view it's a known limitation as described on the doc:
** [Changing the default order for comments from ascending to descending|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/changing-the-default-order-for-comments-from-ascending-to-descending-884344544.html]

h3. Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Updating jira.issue.actions.order does not take place

fields.description:
Changing the issue type of an issue requires that you know to click on the icon & could be improved to be more explicit/intuitive.

Also, in reviewing the markup, there is no indication of the button label (problematic for screen reader users).
fields.summary: Improve usability/accessibility around issue type capabilities

fields.description:
When linking a Confluence page to an issue, the field that gets updated is called _Remote Link_.

However, this field cannot be added to a validator that would make the field mandatory when creating or transitioning an issue.

Please consider adding this field to the validator, so that project administrators can make it mandatory (required)
fields.summary: possibility to make issue link to Confluence page mandatory

fields.description:
*Problem definition*
 * Currently, there is only one option to invite users who are *Trusted* – where the user can access, configure, and add products. Can invite users.

*Suggested solution*
 * To have a feature like the *Trusted user* to invite users only without *administration* privilege
fields.summary: Allowing a feature to invite user only without administration capabilty

fields.description:
When working with a large amount of content, not having the RTE formatting bar visible makes the editing less efficient. Having to continually scroll to the top of the box to get to the editor functions is a very time-consuming task. Also, trying to get to the same location where you were can be very difficult. 

Video example: https://cl.ly/082c61b60e65
fields.summary: Keep the rich text editor fixed when scrolling to a page with multiple lines of text

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 8 February 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone, the project picker custom field is now available in the new issue view. Thank you for the feedback on this ticket. If you have any questions, please comment below. 

Thanks, 

Jira Cloud team
{panel}
Currently, the project picker field is only available for the old issue view and we would like this field *enabled for the new issue view* as well.
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-12 at 09.11.34.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Enable the project picker field for new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
A single user would be able to see the activities of all users on the site even if they do not belong to the same group.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add a permission level where users may only see activities of other users if they are group members.
fields.summary: Allow users to see other users only if they belong to the same group

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Subtasks only show logged time in a progress bar of the View of Sub-Task in the parent issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow a method to configure to display the logged-in time in hours rather than progress bar in the parent issue screen in Jira Cloud.
fields.summary: Allow showing logged time in hours rather than progress bar of the View of Sub-Task in Parent Issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Re-appearance of the deleted resolution code Done when an issue is moved to right most column in next-gen project.  The Done resolution also reappears if it is deleted from the global resolution list.([https://<sitename>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewResolutions.jspa|https://%3Csitename%3E.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewResolutions.jspa])

 
h3. Steps
 * Create a next-gen project.
 * Delete the resolution code DONE.
 * Go to next-gen project and create a new issue.
 * From the boards of the next-gen project, move the newly created issue to the extreme right column (DONE).  

*DONE* resolution code will be automatically re-created with description: GreenHopper Managed Resolution

OR

Delete it from the global resolution list ([https://<sitename>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewResolutions.jspa|https://%3Csitename%3E.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewResolutions.jspa])

 

*NOTE:* 
 There is an existing bug where resolution code DONE is automatically re-created when a next-gen project is created. 
 Existing bug
  
h3. Expected

Resolution code DONE should be removed completely and the existing issues are migrated to the desired resolution code. 

 
h3. Currently

The resolution code DONE re-appears

 
h3.  Workaround 

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Re-appearance of the deleted resolution code Done

fields.description:
Hi,

it would be helpful to hiding / showing panels on issue screen view per project. At the moment I can only do that per site

Our company works wit Jira Software and Jira ServiceDesk, we use a lot of different plugins. It bothers that so many panels are displayed even though they are only used in a few projects.

 

Regards, Thomas
fields.summary: Hide / Show panels on detailed issue view screen per project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Allow Select List (cascading) Child - second value to be required
fields.summary: Allow Select List (cascading) Child - second value to be required

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Despite getting a push notification, notification feed is empty.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Push notification on Android App
* Notification feed is empty

h3. Expected Results
Push notification on Android App should show notification feed

h3. Actual Results
Push notification on Android App does not show notification feed

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Despite getting push notification, notification feed is empty.

fields.description:
Hi,

I would like to suggest that you modify the visibility of added fields shown on card layouts, so that these only shows if the field is included in the screen of a given issue type.

-------

A concrete example.

We use due date for our deploy issue type. But on none of the other issue types. It's very helpfull to have it visible in the sprint view as a talking point at stand-ups.

This conflicts with another focus of ours, which is to keep the sprint view lean and free of irrelevant fields and information.

In it's current state when adding a field to the card layout any issue will have the field added. Those without the field in their screen will all have "None" added underneath them, expanding all ours cards and crowding the sprint view.
fields.summary: Fields on card layouts shouldn't be shown when field isn't included in issue type screen

fields.description:
Pasting an image into the comment field won't work in Microsoft Edge. It works when using Chrome.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Access an issue and select the comment field;
 # Paste an image

*Expected results:*
 The image is attached to the comment.

*Actual result:*
 Nothing happens.

Additional notes:
 Tested using Microsoft Edge 42.17134.1.0
fields.summary: Copy and paste attachments into the comment field doesn't work when using Microsoft Edge

fields.description:
This is checkable on any User Picker in Jira that uses https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/popups/UserPickerBrowser.jspa. (i.e: the one you see in the "shared filters" page). 

The picker seems to *only actually search in the system when using the "E-mail contains or Full name Contains"*. When doing so it brings a maximum of 100 users (*let's call this initial search*). Filtering for groups after the initial search *will only bring results from within the initial 100 users*.

If you re-do the search using the text searchers you re-do the initial search creating another array of 100 users in which the group filter will be limited to.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a user starting with 'B' and another with 'A'. 
# Insert both users in the same group
# Using the picker search "Full Name Contains" = A > Click filter (feel free to erase the search box after that, it won't make a difference)
# Use the group picker to search for the group where those users are in.

h3. Expected results

It is expected that a subsequent search meets the conditions that you're searching for, not cascading results from the last search, this can cause confusion as users may think that users are not being returned.

h3. Actual Results

Only users that were on the search for "A" will be found (the user with the letter B won't be listed).

h3. Workaround
Use always an alphanumerical search before filtering for groups.
fields.summary: UserPickerBrowser.jspa inconsistent filtering for groups.

fields.description: We are looking for the ability to turn-off or restrict access to NextGen projects to prevent users from accidentally creating them.  NextGen projects cannot be retrieved in our JQL queries or use our custom fields.
fields.summary: Ability to turn-off or restrict access to NextGen projects for users or user groups

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When a user is added to the instance, on their first login, they must pass through the "Welcome to Jira" purple pop-up before start using Jira.
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-07 at 10.31.41.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested resolution

Have the ability to disable this "Welcome to Jira" purple pop-up to all new users.

The workaround is to use the Skip question button.
fields.summary: Ability to disable the "Welcome to Jira" purple pop-up

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * When any special character is added in the backlog search. The URL retains the special character and does not refresh when it is removed or changes
h3. Environment

 * Jira cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Go to any backlog section of Jira software project
 # Type the following:
 ##  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 # Special character removed
 ##  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 # The URL search result retains the character despite changing or removing the special character as shown below:
 ## {code} secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=16&view=planning.nodetail&search=ca%5B{code}
 
h3. Expected Results
* Dynamically change when the character is removed or changed

h3. Actual Results
* The URL search result retains the character despite changing or removing the special character

h3. Workaround
* Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: URL search result retains the special character from backlog search.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Removing a field from the screen still displays the field on the issue if the field has a value

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the Time Tracking to the Issue Screen
# Create an issue and add values for the Time Tracking (work logs and estimation)
# Go to the project settings and remove the Time Tracking from the issue screen
# It removes the field from the field layout
# The field still displays at the issue and allows to edit the field

h3. Expected Results
Removing the field from the field screen should remove the field from the issue view even that the field has a value.

h3. Actual Results
Removing the field from the field screen does not remove the field from the issue view if the field has a value.

h3. Workaround
Clear the values from the Time Tracking (delete work logs and estimations) and the field will be removed.
fields.summary: Removing a field from the screen still displays the field on the issue if the field has a value

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

Currently managing batched notifications is not available within Jira to control the time-frame for batched notification to consolidate into an email.
h3. Resolution suggested

Provide the ability to configure the batched notification.
fields.summary: Ability to manage Batched notification in jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Instead of *Former user* being the value displayed for fields such as *assignee* or *reporter* where a deleted user is present, the *full name* value is being retrieved from their Atlassian Account.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user.
 # Assign them an issue or make them the reporter.
 # Remove the user from the site.
 # View the issue where they are included.

h3. Expected Results

The deleted user is displayed as *Former user*
h3. Actual Results

The *full name* value from their Atlassian Account is shown.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: (Former user) not being displayed for deleted users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Creating a custom field using Text Field (single line) and adding a value followed by a dot causes a hyperlink to be appended to the value.
  
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field of type Text Field (single line)
 # Add that field to the Screens of a Project
 # Create an Issue and try to add a value followed by a dot. e.g. *7.01* or *hello.com*

h3. Expected Results

The value should simply be added without displaying as a hyperlink.
h3. Actual Results

The value is added with a hyperlink appended to it.
 !single-line.png|thumbnail!
||Space Added||No Space Added||
|!no-link.png|thumbnail!|!linked.png|thumbnail!|
|When a Space character is added in front of the value, this is the behaviour|when no space character is added in front to the value, it displays as a hyperlink|
h3. Notes

This behaviour does not occur on the Old Issue view. To add some context
 * with <space> character this field only has a *<div>* tag that wraps it with the inline edit button.
 * without <space> character, the field dynamically adds a *<a href=“”>* tag appended to it after the *<div>* tag.

h3. Workaround

Add 1 <space> character in front of the Number value before saving doesn't show any hyperlinks.
fields.summary: Custom fields of Text Field (single line) Appends Hyperlink when a Value is followed by a dot character on the New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When generating an XML backup from a cloud instance, the Project Shortcuts data are not exported.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generate a *Back up for cloud* or *Back up for server*.

h3. Expected Results

Project shortcuts are included in the XML backup.

h3. Actual Results

Project shortcuts are not included in the XML backup.

The Project Shortcuts data is stored in the table {{AO_550953_SHORTCUT}}.

From a Cloud backup
{code:none}
grep "AO_550953_SHORTCUT" activeobjects.xml{code}
will return nothing.

From a Server backup, this table is included.
{code:none}
grep "AO_550953_SHORTCUT" activeobjects.xml 
  <table name="AO_550953_SHORTCUT">
  <data tableName="AO_550953_SHORTCUT">
{code}

h3. Workaround
Manually recreate the project shortcuts.
fields.summary: Generating an XML backup from cloud does not include Project Shortcuts data

fields.description:
As a cloud site administrator to an instance in at a company in an industry that demands we practice a high level of security, I would like the ability to restrict the users in my instance from ever sharing filters or dashboards (or other assets) publicly while still allowing them to otherwise openly collaborate across the instance.

We have a [global permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-global-permissions-776636359.html] on which we can restrict users from sharing filters/dashboard, but this does not prevent them from sharing publicly those filters.
fields.summary: Restrict users ability to create public filters/dashboards

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when a user created during CSV issue import, there are no options to disable the invitation email. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide options to disable invitation email.

h3. Why this is important
Admin doesn't want to send invitation email on purposes. For example, if the user already left the company but admin still need their information as reporter/assignee.

h3. Workaround 
Invite the user upfront before perform CSV issue import. You can disable invitation email from there.
fields.summary: Option to disable invitation email when user created from CSV import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Anonymous users with https://<SITENAME>.atlassian.net/secure/ManageFilters.jspa should be prompted to log in instead of showing the page below
 !Screenshot 2019-08-06 at 15.08.46.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Anonymous users should be prompted to log in

h3. Actual Results
Anonymous users are shown the page below
 !Screenshot 2019-08-06 at 15.08.46.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Users with https://<SITENAME>.atlassian.net/secure/ManageFilters.jspa should be prompted to log in

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition 
Currently it's not possible to retrieve that who has updated a custom field in an issue. This information is stored in issue "History", but there's no buiilt-in function to generate reports based on that.

h3. Suggested resolution
Implement the ability to generate reports based on users that have updated a specific field. For example to get list of users that have selected a "Checkbox" field in issues
fields.summary: Ability to search issues or generate report based on users who have updated a specific field in the issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the profile language is set to another language besides English, the number field is not accepting the decimal point

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a number custom field, i.e Number of Days
# Add any number with decimal point in the field, i.e 5.5
# Set the profile language as Dansk (Danmark)
# In the issue search, search for the issue with the custom field with value that you've just entered, i.e Project = ABC and Number of Days = 5.5

h3. Expected Results

Number field should accept decimal point in all languages

h3. Actual Results

An error stating that the value number is not a valid number

h3. Workaround

Switch the language settings to English in your *Personal Settings*.
fields.summary: Number field doesn't accept decimal point when using different language settings

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After migration from Jira server to Jira cloud, whenever customers (Jira Service Desk) are reverted back to users, the user key is recorded as a hash in the format: 
* qm:hash1:hash2

This is a large string that is recorded under the user tables of Jira and there might be tables that don't allow the number of characters.

h3. Problem
A scenario which this is happening is when adding a single user with this characteristic to a notification scheme.

The notification scheme table doesn't allow this action because the user key exceeds the number of allowed characters.

h3. Workaround
Set up the notification scheme by groups or roles instead of single-user.
fields.summary: Error 500 displayed when entered value exceeds 60 characters in the notification scheme.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When multi-clicking in the *X* while deleting a post-function, other post-functions will be unexpectedly deleted as well – including not deletable post-functions.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a post-function that will be the first in the list – such as update resolution field;
 # Click on the *X* a few times – three would do the job;
 # 3 Post-functions will be excluded, including some system ones such as *Set issue status to the linked status of the destination workflow step.*

h3. Expected Results

Delete only the post-function that was selected.
h3. Actual Results

Post-functions are deleted based on the number of times clicked – 3 clicks, 3 deleted post-functions.
h3. Notes

Video Reproducing the behavior: [^Screen Recording 2019-08-05 at 10.54 AM.mov]
h3. Workaround

Discard the workflow changes by discarding the draft or save a backup after workflow changes to easily be able to restore the original one.
fields.summary: Multi-clicking while deleting Workflow Post-Function delete unwanted Post-functions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When loading Jira reports provided by third part apps an error 500 is thrown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a third party app that provides reports such as Tempo.
 # Load one of the app provided reports

h3. Expected Results
The report loads without error.

h3. Actual Results
The report does not load and error as below is displayed:
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
Error type: 500 - Internal server error
Log reference: b943a05b-270d-4c98-8f85-8f7647313492
{noformat}
h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Loading third party reports in Jira results in a 500 error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

* When the URL in the webhook target is supplied by a URL shortening service(e.g. bit.ly), the HTTP client that processes the webhook is unable to redirect
* Customers may choose to use a URL shortening service to work around another bug [JRACLOUD-67484|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67484]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use a URL shortening service to generate a URL
 # Create a webhook as per [these instructions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-webhooks-776636231.html]
# Use the generated URL as the webhook URL target
# Trigger the webhook in Jira as per configuration

h3. Expected Results
* Webhook is triggered based on a Jira event

h3. Actual Results
* Nothing happens - webhook is not triggered

h3. Notes
* Testing has shown that URLs generated by tiny.url do not work
* Bit.ly generated URLs have been observed to be working at the time of writing  - if not, please contact  [Atlassian support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/] 
* You may need to use unencoded parameter strings, e.g. 
{noformat}
example.domain/page?token=abcdegfh=
{noformat}
Instead of...
{noformat}
example.domain/page?token=abcdegfh%3d
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
* Contact [Atlassian support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/] for a workaround
fields.summary: Webhooks: URL shortening service redirection behaviour not as expected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to Create Issue From Capture Addon due to Jira Changes
h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1.The issue creation requests sent from the capture for Jira chrome extensions are proxied via POST [https://prod-capture.zephyr4jiracloud.com/capture/issue-ext]

2.The returned results from this proxy

{"status":400,"errorMessages":[],"errors":

{"summary":"Field 'summary' cannot be set. It is not on the appropriate screen...}

*Expected Results*

Issue should be created with the predefined fields

*Actual Results*

{"status":400,"errorMessages":[],"errors":

{"summary":"Field 'summary' cannot be set. It is not on the appropriate screen...}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. We are working with Zephyr team on this issue and will update this bug ticket once there are more details.
fields.summary: Unable to Create issue From Capture Addon due to Jira Changes

fields.description:
This is a problem both for the Issue Navigator and the JIRA Issues Macro available in Confluence.

h3. Workaround

To work around this issue, call the filter by number and apply the sort at the time of use. Example:

{code}filter = 47420 ORDER BY priority DESC{code}

As reported by a customer:

{quote}An Employee created a search filter. 
When run it includes the ORDER BY priority DESC.
If you go to the full url of the search string it works as expected, and you can click on the P column to sort by priority. Given the operator in the filter it appears properly as descending.
If within Jira you do a search filter="some sumber"
It displays the tickets, however the priority is not shown in DESC order. There is no way of course to click on it either. 
This is causing issues as we use the Jira macro to list jira tickets based on a filter. While prior with wiki mark up we could add operators, this is not possible now.
In this case with the Jira macro it truncates the url to filter="some number"
This is an issue as we want to display the list properly sorted based on the search criteria. We are able to replicate this in Jira, but creating a filter, then doing a search with filter="Some number"{quote}

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Manage Filters
# Identify the filterid of any filter
# Go to the Issue Navigator
-# In Advanced mode, enter filter=<id>
# Compare to the results of clicking through to the filter from Manage Filters
fields.summary: Filter Id based searches are not preserving the ORDER BY sort order clause

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary -  

The user in JIRA mobile app can see some saved filters multiple times. This happens for a few users and not all.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to JIRA mobile application.
 # Go to Saved filters and refresh. 

Expected Results - Filter names will appear.
 Actual Results - Not all filters appear and the few that appears, repeat itself multiple time.

Device specifications:

Mobile - Huawei mate 9
 The app version is v30.0.325
 The OS is Android 9.0.1.192

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Saved filters not working in expected manner in Jira mobile application.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
There Strikethrough formatting is not distinguishable from dash (-) when used in webhook body. This causes confusion when using strikethrough and dash

h3. Environment
Jira cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira webhook for comment
# Trigger the webhook by adding a comment with strikethrough text (ShakiruTest)
# Check the webhook body
# Strikethrough appears as "-ShakiruTest-"

h3. Expected Results
Strikethrough formatting is distinguishable from dash (-)
h3. Actual Results
Strikethrough formatting is not distinguishable from dash (-)

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Strikethrough formatting not distinguishable from dash (-) in webhook body

fields.description:
At this moment, _next-gen_ projects do not have a _default assignee_, like classic projects have.

Please implement a functionality that will allow admins to change this.

Classic projects have this under _project settings_:
 !image (8).png|thumbnail! 

But next-gen projects do not have this setting:
 !Settings_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: ability to change the default assignee on next-gen projects

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 12 Feb 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone, we just released "global loop transition" in the new issue view. Here are a few support documentation for your convenience related to this feature as well 

*JSW end users*
 [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/transition-an-issue/]
 *JSM end users*
 [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/move-an-issue-through-its-workflow-from-the-issue-view]
 *Jira Cloud admins*
 [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/work-with-issue-workflows/]
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Using the "Any Status" Transition to itself on a Workflow doesn't work on the New Issue view. 
 !transition.png|thumbnail! 
 !workflow.png|thumbnail!
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Project
 # Go to the Workflow
 # Add a New Transition from "Any Status" to "itself" give it a Name
 # Publish the Workflow.

h3. Expected Results

The New Transition buttons should be able to show, as how it has been configured.
h3. Actual Results

The Transition buttons doesn't show and somehow is hidden on the New Issue View
||OLD ISSUE VIEW||NEW ISSUE VIEW||
|!old-view.png|thumbnail!|!new-view.png|thumbnail!|
|Transition buttons visible|Transition button hidden|
h3. Notes

Points to note that this shows perfectly on the Old Issue View.
h3. Workaround

Switch to the Old Issue view in order to View or use those Buttons, since they have the "All Transition"
 * Goto *Profile avatar > Personal Settings* Under Jira Labs toggle the action button on the Jira New Issue View to "OFF"
fields.summary: Any Status Transition to itself on Workflow doesn't show on New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Error while setting regular expression in workflow conditions
h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a regular expression with *type option* as part of the workflow conditions for a custom field with type options list:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 # Try creating an issue with the workflow conf. You will encounter the below error:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

It should validate the regular expression and allow the user to create an issue when the condition is met.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
Throws the error:

 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Error while setting regular expression in workflow conditions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Korean letters (Hangul) showing irrelevant characters when exported and viewed from Excel

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create issue which contains Korean Characters 
 # Go to the Issue Navigator and Export to Excel CSV
 # Open the file in Excel

h3. Expected Results
Characters display the Korean Characters correctly in Excel
 !Screenshot 2019-08-02 at 6.19.37 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Excel shows irrelevant characters in Excel 
 !Screenshot 2019-08-02 at 6.19.45 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Refer from the text editor to view the characters correctly
 !Screenshot 2019-08-02 at 6.20.56 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Korean letters (Hangul) showing irrelevant characters when exported and viewed from Excel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you navigate from the issue to its parent from the breadcrumb, the browser's tab title will not update.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create an Epic;
* Create an issue under that Epic;
* Navigate to the issue from within the Epic;
* Navigate back to the Epic by using the breadcrumb;
* See the recording:  [^Tab title bug.mp4] 

The same occurs between Issues and Sub-tasks.
 
h3. Expected Results

The title of the browser tab will be updated.

h3. Actual Results

The title of the browser tab remains the same as from the issue.

h3. Workaround

Reloading the page will update the tab's title.
fields.summary: Navigating from an issue back to its Parent will not update the browse's tab title

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When users attempt to create a new issue by pressing the plus sign "+" button in the left menu while on the BrowseProjects page (https://instancename.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa), the Portfolio for Jira fields cannot be selected.

h3. Environment

* Jira Software cloud
* Portfolio for Jira cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the Portfolio fields "Teams" and "Parent issue" to a Jira Software classic project screens
# Access the URL https://instancename.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa
# Click *Create issue (+)* in the left menu

h3. Expected Results

The Portfolio fields are editable

h3. Actual Results

The Portfolio fields are not editable and show the following message:

 !Screen Shot 2019-08-02 at 1.27.21 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

This problem is visible only when you try to create issues via https://instancename.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa

h3. Workaround

Create issues from the project view or from the dashboard view
fields.summary: Creating issues using the plus signal "+" doesn't allow users to set a value to Portfolio fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # define a property and add it to a user
 # query via REST API for that user's property to confirm it's been set:
{code}
<sitename>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user/properties/<property-name>?accountId=<the Atlassian Account ID>
{code}
# search for all users with that property by querying 
{code}
<sitename>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user/search?property=<propertyname>.value=true
{code}

h3. Expected Results
All users with that property will be returned

h3. Actual Results
Only an empty string ( [] ) is returned

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Searching for users with a certain property via REST API returns empty string

fields.description:
Documentation for *Unmanaged Users* used to be available. However, at this point, the documentation is missing.

Previous documentation link that appears to be missing from Confluence site.
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-account-for-users-873871199.html#Atlassianaccountforusers-Unmanagedaccounts
fields.summary: Documentation for Unmanaged Users is missing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new issue view, when depending on the size of your browser's window or your monitor size, the list of *Labels* can't get cut off, making it difficult to scroll to the top of the list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a long list of *Labels* available on your site
# Decrease the size of your browser's window

 !_NGFF-17__Test_issue_type_full.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The scroll list size should adjust according to the size of the window and allow you to scroll through.

h3. Actual Results

The list is cut off and you can't scroll to the top, making it difficult to reach some *Labels* on the list

 !_NGFF-17__Test_issue_type_bug_import_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround
# Expand the browser's window size if possible.
# Zoom out
# Switch to the old Issue view
fields.summary: List of Labels gets cut off and can't scroll through the list in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
When you click on your profile photo in following page a list of cloud applications where you have access appears under "My cloud products":
* https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence

If you click on any application you will be redirected to the cloud site. For example if your Confluence application is at *mysite.atlassian.net* when you click on Confluence you will be redirected to [*https://mysite.atlassian.net*|https://mysite.atlassian.net], and will be landed to the [site's landing product|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/set-your-site-s-landing-product-873871363.html] not to Confluence product in the site.
 !Screenshot.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested resolution
Please update the permalink for each product and set it product specific. For example products' permalinks in *mysite.atlassian.net* should be as following:
* Confluence: https://mysite.atlassian.net/wiki
* JIRA: https://mysite.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa
fields.summary: Set application specific permalink for each product

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the Search Issue screen, try searching a issue using a field(e.g. reporter) and confirm that it returns the issue
# Try searching the issue with another field(e.g. assignee)

h3. Expected Results
The issue is returned as well

h3. Actual Results
The issue is not returned

h3. Note
This is due to an incorrect mapping of a certain field in the database(in the above case, assignee field)
 
h3. Workaround
Please [contact support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/] with the following information
* The JQL(or search criteria) you used
* The issue that is expected to appear
* A link to this bug ticket(https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-72656)
fields.summary: Searching for issues using certain field doesn't return the expected result

fields.description:
At this moment, the notification panel only notifies the user from the issues that he's watching and for the mentions to its user on tickets (Direct messages).

It would be useful if the user could customize the notifications of this panel as it does on the notification schemes for the projects. For example, be able to get notifications when an issue is created and he's not yet involved in it. 

This is important since some users prefer to follow the updates through the Jira screen, instead of to be following notifications on another screen (Like email or Slack channel).
fields.summary: Customized notifications for the notification panel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the New Issue view, when navigating across a Parent and Child Issue, the document title on the Browser when click on the Child Issue is retained and when you navigate back to the Parent issue it still carries the title of the Child issue rather than the parent issue.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Issue in your Project having a Parent and Child Hierarchy.
 # For example, Story issuetype and its corresponding sub-task
 # Create a Summary for both issues.
 ## https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-1 (Story issue)
 ## https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-2 (sub-task)
 # Navigate to the Story issue then click on the sub-task issue, then click on the story issue link on the top Nav button.

h3. Expected Results

The document title of the current issue being viewed should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

The Sub-task Issue Title is retained while being on the Parent issue
|!parent.png|thumbnail!|!sub-task.png|thumbnail!|
|*Parent Issue*|*sub-task Issue*|
h3. Notes

Point to note that the New Issue View uses SPA (Single Page App) which makes seamless navigation possible and dynamically load pages fast. In so doing, the document title is suppose to be loaded dynamically when such switch occurs.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incorrect Document Title showing on Browser when moving across Parent and Child Issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding an attachment inside a comment does not display the file under attachment panel on the new issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue
# Add a comment with an attachment
# The attachment is loaded inside the comment but not displayed at the attachment panel on the new issue view.

h3. Expected Results
The attachment added through a comment should be displayed on the attachment panel
h3. Actual Results
The attachment is not displayed on the attachment panel on the new issue view

h3. Workaround
Disable the new issue view from your *user avatar > Personal settings* or include 
{code}
?oldIssueView=true
{code}
to the end of the URL
fields.summary: Adding an attachment inside a comment does not display the file under attachment panel on the new issue view

fields.description:
When viewing an issue in the new issue view, it is no longer possible to edit an issue using the edit screen and this creates some inconvenience in editing the issue by field as the notification from Jira trigger on every field modification. 

I would like to suggest offering the edit screen as an option in the transition menu.
fields.summary: Ability to edit issue with edit issue screen from new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Name of a transition is not case sensitive, result is an error message. For example renaming a transition from "Test Failed" to "Test failed" fails with the error message "A transition with that name already exists".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Project settings > Workflows
 # Click on Edit of one of the workflows
 # Click on a transition and click on Edit
 # Change the name of the transition so that only a small cap is changed to capital letter and click on Save

h3. Expected Results
Either the modification should be successful or the error message should be more specific or the fact that the name is not case sensitive should be mentioned in documentation.

h3. Actual Results
An error message saying "A transition with that name already exists"

h3. Notes
None

h3. Workaround
 # Change the name in 2 steps:
 # Add something to the new name: Test Failed > Test failedx
 # Remove that something: Test failedx > Test failed
fields.summary: Name of a transition is not case sensitive, changing only case of letters results in error message

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Description area doesn't allow custom fields that are not multi-line text type.

h3. Suggested resolution
Allow the description area to accept more custom field types.

h3. Workaround
Disable *Jira labs* under *Personal settings*
fields.summary: New Issue View - Allow other custom fields types that are not multi-line text in the description area

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

As of now, Jira Cloud does not have a way to validate the status of a linked epic issue from a Jira task. It would be beneficial if we have the feature so that we could restrict user from creating an issue when the epic link status has been transitioned to "Done"

h3. Suggested Resoution

Allow epic link status validator
fields.summary: Ability to add validator based on the epic link status

fields.description:
h3. Description
Currently, it is not possible to edit the project type and it is necessary to create a project category.

h3. Suggestion for Improvement
It would be nice to have an option to edit the project type.
fields.summary: Customize/Edit the Project Type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the old issue view, links are added links [This is a link|https://abc.com]. It is searchable by fieldname = 'abc.com'. However, when the same set using the new issue view, the field cannot be searched. The user has to use the text "This is a link" instead of the actual link.

h3. Expected Results
The issue does not show up when running the JQL

h3. Actual Results
The issue should show up when running the JQL

h3. Workaround
Use the old issue view
fields.summary: Links in new issue view cannot be searched

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment
Jira app for iOS or Android

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue and put the link to another issue in its description
 # View the issue on a mobile device, either Android or iOS

h3. Expected Results
The linked issue appears with a nice formatting that includes the issue key, summary and status, just like on desktop:
 !_KT-12__it_s_epic_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Instead of the nice formatting, only the URL is shown:
 !Screenshot_20190730-174625_Jira.jpg|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Link to another issue is shown as URL on mobile apps

fields.description:
In edit and share dashboard view, by default all the options Group, Project, Any logged-in user and Public are shown in *Shares* option.

Provide the ability to show/restrict only a few options in Shares option.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict options visible in Shares in dashboards

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Prepare user A with the following:
** User doesn't have Jira admin permission
** User is Administrator in a next gen project
# Using a Jira admin account, include the next gen project to a project category
# By user A, do the followings:
## Access the project settings
## Update the Name and click "Save"

h3. Expected Results
user A can update the project setting because it has the Administrator privilege of the project

h3. Actual Results
The following error is shown and user A can't update the details 
{code}
Couldn't update details
Your project is a bit special and you don't have permission to update its details. Contact your Jira admin for help.
{code}
 !スクリーンショット 2019-07-31 10.39.11.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Remove the project from the category
fields.summary: Next gen project Administrator can't edit project details when the project is included in a project category

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
Allow Issue list to be refreshed once clicking on the Filter Name via the Issue Navigator
fields.summary: Allow Issue List to be refreshed when clicking on Filter Name from the Issue Navigator view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the new view, when copying the image address, the URL is showing blob:https://... 

In the old view, you'll be able to copy the image address without the blob

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow user to copy the image address without the blob

h3. Why this is important
JIRA Checklist add on would require an image URL to associate with the checklist 

h3. Workaround 
Convert the next gen project to classic project
fields.summary: Allow user to view the attachment's link in the new JIRA issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Admins need the ability to easily track recent changes to any Jira configuration and be able to revert those changes if needed.

h3. Suggested Solution

Implementing a version control system which tracks configuration changes and allow admins to revert any changes to a certain point in time.
fields.summary: As an Admin I would like version control for all configuration changes

fields.description:
h4. Context

Since 2019 Jira is implementing a new editor (as long as a new issue view), which is composed by a *WYSIWYG* editor that works with markdown syntax as well. It would be great if Atlassian shipped an editor *without the WYSIWYG* features, where users would insert *plain text markdown* and would be formatted accordingly.

Bitbucket already has this feature.

h4. Why this is important?

There can be more reasons why some users would prefer text-only editing. Including
* Improve productivity by having fewer clicks (everything would be formatted using the keyboard).
* Avoid WYSIWYG problems
* Eases the task of pasting already formatted code

h4. Proposed Solution

* Have an option to switch from *Visual (WYSIWYG)* to *Text Only* editor
fields.summary: Provide users with a plain text markdown editor

fields.description: It would be nice if [filter subscriptions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/working-with-search-results-764478404.html#Workingwithsearchresults-subscribeSubscribetosearchresults] for Jira Service Desk were able to show the survey results via email. The values are returned as empty at this time and the users need to access each ticket individually in order to see the results.
fields.summary: Show survey results for a JSD filter subscription

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the new editor (WYSIWYG with Markdown), if you create an ordered list, then you try to move the cursor through it while using the *Keyboard Arrows*, it will skip an automatically move the cursor to the *end of the list*

h3. Environment
This was *not reproducible in Chrome*, it seems to happen with Firefox.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
1 - Create some text with an ordered list (example below)
{code}
This is just a normal paragraph where, usually, people write a lot of words to form sentences.

* this is an ordered list
* This is another item from an ordered list
* once again another item
{code}
2 - Place the cursor on the paragraph before the list (or at the end of the list)
3 - Use the arrows to move the cursor up or down


h3. Expected Results
The cursor will move through each of the list items.

h3. Actual Results
The cursor is moved to the end of the list (or beginning if you're using up arrows). The video below shows how this happens.
[^cursor_and_list_bug.mp4] 



h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Text cursor skips ordered list items when pressing down or up arrows using the new editor in Firefox

fields.description:
h5. *Summary*

The user performed a Server merge of two Cloud instances. In this merge, a Service Desk customer was made a Jira User. 

h5. *Problem*

When transitioning issues, the user is receiving a PSQL error such as:

{code}
Caught PSQLException for select "O_S_WORKFLOW_ENTRY"."id", "O_S_WORKFLOW_ENTRY"."name", "O_S_WORKFLOW_ENTRY"."initialized", "O_S_WORKFLOW_ENTRY"."state" from "public"."os_wfentry" "O_S_WORKFLOW_ENTRY" where "O_S_WORKFLOW_ENTRY"."id" = ? limit ?
{code}

h5. *Workaround*

Contact Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Fix userassociation table to increase source_name column size

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to create a sub-task, if there is a field set as *required*, or a validator (e.g. field required validator) , the sub-task create screen will show up.

The date time/date time picker calendar icon does not work.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure there is a field *required* for the *Sub-task* issue type;
 # Try to create a subtask.

h3. Expected Results

The date picker is displayed and a date can be selected by clicking on the calendar icon.
h3. Actual Results

The date picker is not displayed. The following error is displayed in the browsers development console.
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-30 at 10.37.47.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Enter the date manually using the default jira.date.picker.java.format: {{dd/MMM/yy}} - i.e. 30/Jul/19
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-30 at 10.29.15.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-30 at 10.30.24.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-30 at 10.29.45.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Date Picker/Date Time Picker not working in sub-task create screen
